# CUNY Bridge Program, R Module, Week 2 Homework
## Create a Function for "N choose R"
### Define the function

```{r}

choose <- function(n, r) {
    if (n - r < 0) {
        answer <- 0
        answer
    } else if (n - r == 0) {
        answer <- 1
        answer
    } else if (n - r > 0) {
        nfact <- 1
        for (i in 1:n) {
            nfact <- nfact * i
            nfact
        }
        rfact <- 1
        for (i in 1:r) {
            rfact <- rfact * i
            rfact
        }
        sub <- n - r
        sfact <- 1
        for (i in 1:sub) {
            sfact <- sfact * i
            sfact
        }
        answer <- nfact / (sfact * rfact)
        answer
    }
}

```
### Test the Function

#### Standard answers

```{r}
a1 <- choose(5,3)
a2 <- choose(10,2)
```

a1 = `r a1`
a2 = `r a2`

#### Exceptions
```{r}
e1 <- choose(2,4)
e2 <- choose(2,2)
```

e1 = `r e1`
e2 = `r e2`
